title: A novel cylindrical TE<sub>2,1</sub> mode converter
excerpt: This paper examines the numerical design, simulation, construction and testing of a rectangular to cylindrical waveguide mode converter. Using slots machined along the length of the cylindrical section, mode conversion can be forced from the TE<sub>1,0</sub> rectangular mode to the TE<sub>2,1</sub> cylindrical mode.
citation: D.A. Constable, X.S. Fampris, K. Ronald, W. He, C.G. Whyte, and C.W. Robertson, (2010). "A novel TE2,1 mode converter" Rev. Sci. Instrum., 81, 094702.

title: Numerical simulations of a co-harmonic gyrotron
venue: Journal of Physics D: Applied Physics
excerpt: This paper details numerical simulations of a co-harmonic gyro-multiplier.
citation: D.A. Constable, K. Ronald, W. He, A.D.R. Phelps, A.W. Cross, A.V. Savilov, V.L. Bratman and I.V. Bandurkin (2012). "Numerical simulations of a co-harmonic gyrotron" J. Phys. D.. 45, 065105.

title: A millimeter-wave klystron upconverter with a higher order mode output cavity
excerpt: This paper examines two klystron designs, where the output cavities operate in higher order modes, allowing a third harmonic signal to be extracted.
citation: G. Burt, L. Zhang, D.A. Constable, H. Yin, C.J. Lingwood, W. He, C. Paoloni, and A.W. Cross, (2017). "A millimeter-wave klystron upconveter with a higher order mode output cavity" IEEE Trans. Elec. Dev.. 64(9), pp. 3857-3862.

title: Energetic particle signatures above Saturn's aurorae
venue: Journal of Geophysical Research: Space Physics
excerpt: This paper examines data from the Cassini spacecraft while it was in orbit of Saturn. Strong upward and downward travelling particle beams are observed, indicating the presence of strong parallel potentials.
citation: A. Bader, S.V. Badman, L.C. Ray, C.P. Paranicas, C.T.S. Lorch, G. Clark, M. Andre, D.G. Mitchell, D.A. Constable, J. Kinrade, G.J. Hunt, and W. Pryor, (2020). "Energetic particle signatures above Saturn's aurorae" JGR: Space Physics. 125(1), 2019JA027403.

title: The effect of field-aligned currents and centrifugal forces on ionospheric outflow at Saturn
venue: Journal of Geophysical Research: Space Physics
excerpt: This paper investigates the ionospheric outflow from high latitude regions of Saturn through the use of a numerical model.
citation: C.J. Martin, L.C. Ray, M. Felici, D.A. Constable, C.T.S. Lorch, J. Kinrade and R.L. Gray, (2020). "The effect of field-aligned currents and centrifugal forces on ionspheric outflow at Saturn", JGR: Space Physics, 125(7), e2019JA027728.

title: Evaluating the ionospheric mass source for Jupiter's magnetosphere: An ionospheric outflow model for the auroral regions
venue: Journal of Geophysical Research: Space Physics
excerpt: This paper investigates the ionospheric outflow from high latitude regions of Jupiter through the use of a numerical model.
citation: C.J. Martin, L.C. Ray, D.A. Constable, D.J. Southwood, C.T.S. Lorch, and M. Felici, (2020). "TEvaluating the ionospheric mass source for Jupiter's magnetosphere: An ionospheric outflow model for the auroral regions", JGR: Space Physics, 125(7), e2019JA027727.

title: A complete data set of equatorial projections of Saturn's energetic neutral atom emissions observed by Cassini-INCA
venue: Journal of Geophysical Research: Space Physics
excerpt: This paper details an algorithm used to produce a complete dataset of equatorial projections of ENA emission at Saturn, as observed by Cassini's INCA instrument.
citation: A. Bader, J. Kinrade, S.V. Badman, C. Paranicas, D.A. Constable, and D.G. Mitchell, (2021). "A complete data set of equatorial projections of Saturn's energetic neutral atom emissions observed by Cassini-INCA", JGR: Space Physics, 125(7), e2020JA028908.

title: The statistical morphology of Saturn's equatorial energetic neutral atom emission Geophysical Research Letters
venue: This paper uses the equatorial ENA dataset to examine long term statistical morphologies.
excerpt: J. Kinrade, A. Bader, S.V. Badman, C. Paranicas, D.G. Mitchell, D.A. Constable, C.S. Arridge, S.W.H. Cowley and G. Provan, (2021). "The statistical morphology of Saturn's equatorial energetic neutral atom emission", JGR: Space Physics, 48(11), e2020GL091595.
